overview: This subject aims to introduce students to research in the field of oral health sciences. Through engaging with current research in the field, students will learn about major advances and research gaps in oral health sciences and be exposed to a range of research approaches. Students will develop their understanding of research design and skills in critical evaluation and scientific communication.
intended learning outcomes: Critically assess and effectively summarise published research in an area of oral health.
Articulate the scientific and technical basis of advanced techniques in oral health research.
Defend the importance of applying intellectual integrity and ethical principles in the conduct of research with animals and humans.
Critically evaluate  scientific data, including manuscripts.

additional pre-requisite: Note: the following subject/s can also be taken concurrently (at the same time)

assessments.description: Scientific critique of a journal article. 2000 words
An article based on research presented at the MDS Seminar Series. 1000 words

Semester 1.Contact hours: At least 1 hour per week to attend a seminar or consult with their supervision about assignments.

Semester 2.Contact hours: At least 1 hour per week to attend a seminar or consult with their supervision about assignments.

Subject notes: Students must be enrolled in the Bachelor of Biomedicine (Honours) or Bachelor of Science (Honours) to complete this subject.
